alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN COLUMBIA...NORTHERN SUWANNEE...HAMILTON...ECHOLS...SOUTHEASTERN ATKINSON...WEST CENTRAL WARE...CLINCH AND NORTHWESTERN CHARLTON COUNTIES THROUGH 545 PM EDT... At 506 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Pearson to Suwannee River State Park. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, Jasper, Homerville, Pearson, Jennings, White Springs, Fargo, Argyle, Statenville, and Suwannee River State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
